text: this is Luna the killer whale a five
year old Orca filmed in Nootka sound
Canada doing an impression of a boat
I've never seen something like an orca
come this close to a boat let alone
trying to talk to it so why is a killer
whale trying to converse with a boat so
nuna is a male Orca that has become
separated from his pod ordinarily orcas
lives socially in their maternal family
groups and they communicate with each
other making vocal clicks and whistles
so mimicking each other is an incredibly
important part of strengthening the
bonds between them but Luna grew up
hearing the sounds of boats so Luna
began to associate those with the sound
he should make and learn to imitate
boats before getting here is an
incredible insight into how sociable
orcas are and how they communicate and
it gives us a real sense of their
intelligence ordinarily this would be
incredibly difficult to film
you
